<a id="class_Script"></a>

# Script

**Inherits:** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

**Inherited By:** [CSharpScript](class_csharpscript.md), [GDScript](class_gdscript.md), [ScriptExtension](class_scriptextension.md)

A class stored as a resource.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A class stored as a resource. A script extends the functionality of all objects that instantiate it.

This is the base class for all scripts and should not be used directly. Trying to create a new script with this class will result in an error.

The ``new`` method of a script subclass creates a new instance. [Object.set_script()](class_object.md#class_Object_method_set_script) extends an existing object, if that object's class matches one of the script's base classes.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Scripting documentation index](../tutorials/scripting/index.md)

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_Script_property_source_code"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](class_string.md) **source_code** [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_property_source_code)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_source_code**\ (\ value\: [String](class_string.md)\ )
- [String](class_string.md) **get_source_code**\ (\ )

The script source code or an empty string if source code is not available. When set, does not reload the class implementation automatically.

## Method Descriptions

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns ``true`` if the script can be instantiated.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_get_base_script"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Script](class_script.md) **get_base_script**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_base_script)

Returns the script directly inherited by this script.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_get_global_name"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[StringName](class_stringname.md) **get_global_name**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_global_name)

Returns the class name associated with the script, if there is one. Returns an empty string otherwise.

To give the script a global name, you can use the ``class_name`` keyword in GDScript and the ``[GlobalClass]`` attribute in C#.




```gdscript
    class_name MyNode
    extends Node
```

```csharp
    using Godot;

    [GlobalClass]
    public partial class MyNode : Node
    {
    }
```



<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_get_rpc_config"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Variant](class_variant.md) **get_rpc_config**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_rpc_config)

Returns a [Dictionary](class_dictionary.md) mapping method names to their RPC configuration defined by this script.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<!-- classref-method -->

[Dictionary](class_dictionary.md) **get_script_constant_map**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_script_constant_map)

Returns a dictionary containing constant names and their values.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_get_script_method_list"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](class_array.md)\[[Dictionary](class_dictionary.md)\] **get_script_method_list**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_script_method_list)

Returns the list of methods in this **Script**.

\ **Note:** The dictionaries returned by this method are formatted identically to those returned by [Object.get_method_list()](class_object.md#class_Object_method_get_method_list).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_get_script_property_list"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](class_array.md)\[[Dictionary](class_dictionary.md)\] **get_script_property_list**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_script_property_list)

Returns the list of properties in this **Script**.

\ **Note:** The dictionaries returned by this method are formatted identically to those returned by [Object.get_property_list()](class_object.md#class_Object_method_get_property_list).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_get_script_signal_list"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](class_array.md)\[[Dictionary](class_dictionary.md)\] **get_script_signal_list**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_get_script_signal_list)

Returns the list of user signals defined in this **Script**.

\ **Note:** The dictionaries returned by this method are formatted identically to those returned by [Object.get_signal_list()](class_object.md#class_Object_method_get_signal_list).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_has_script_signal"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **has_script_signal**\ (\ signal_name\: [StringName](class_stringname.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_has_script_signal)

Returns ``true`` if the script, or a base class, defines a signal with the given name.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_has_source_code"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **has_source_code**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_has_source_code)

Returns ``true`` if the script contains non-empty source code.

\ **Note:** If a script does not have source code, this does not mean that it is invalid or unusable. For example, a [GDScript](class_gdscript.md) that was exported with binary tokenization has no source code, but still behaves as expected and could be instantiated. This can be checked with [can_instantiate()](class_script.md#class_Script_method_can_instantiate).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_instance_has"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **instance_has**\ (\ base_object\: [Object](class_object.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_instance_has)

Returns ``true`` if `base_object` is an instance of this script.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_is_abstract"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **is_abstract**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_is_abstract)

Returns ``true`` if the script is an abstract script. An abstract script does not have a constructor and cannot be instantiated.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_is_tool"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **is_tool**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_is_tool)

Returns ``true`` if the script is a tool script. A tool script can run in the editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Script_method_reload"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](class_@globalscope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **reload**\ (\ keep_state\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Script_method_reload)

Reloads the script's class implementation. Returns an error code.
